reviews.text: Great location!! right next to Luxemburg Garden and the Army Museum Invalides and just over the bridge from Tuilleries and Place Concorde. Very close to the Metro as well.
reviews.title: Nice enough

reviews.text: Lot's of stairs to climb with suitcases, although some one helped us to carry ours to our room. The room was as it looks on the website, so very pleased about that. Beautiful bathroom with wonderful Aesop body care products. Shortbread cookies in a beautiful gold tin were baked for us in the morning we were told. Delicious!! with my own brought coffee. The espresso machine did not want to work for me, but we enjoyed the free refreshments a lot. Perrier and Evian water and soda pop. Air conditioning was not needed but nice for an option. Very Funky fun room. More expensive than others, but I guess you pay for the extra's.
reviews.title: Spacious clean and relaxing room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Asked for a wake up call to get to the airport in the morning- it never came.
reviews.title: Kooky design boutique hotel

reviews.text: Hotel is simple and with well thought facilities. Bath room was unique and good for use. Bed was perfect and other facilities are modern and useful. Hand made cookie were great.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it

reviews.text: I picked the hotel based on the eclectic designs I had seen on their website. I loved the kooky mix of prints, patterns and marble. Great location, both for the Eiffel Tower and all the Paris sights. Really easy to get around whether on the metro or on foot. My only regret was not eating at the restaurant. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel, but would recommend the boulangerie/patisserie across the road - moulin de la vierge.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for boutique hotel

reviews.text: I love the Thoumieux. I stayed there twice.
reviews.title: Small details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, it's tiny and cute. You feel like you're in a guest home rather than in a hotel.
reviews.title: Smaller than small rooms,smallest junior suite ever

reviews.text: I read a lot of review about people not happy with the reception etc. Yes, it's true that sometimes, the receptionist isn't there, and that you might have to go downstairs to the restaurant to let them know you are here. But this doesn't bother me. You know what you are signing for when you stay in a word-of-mouth hotel. If you want the receptionist there all night, go to the Westin or one of these big places.
reviews.title: excellent room,nice meal but service needs improvement

reviews.text: I love the decoration there. My husband doesn't love it (maybe it's too busy and too girly) but I love it. Then, all the rooms have an iPad, a super coffee machine, a free minibar, linen bedsheets, iPod dock, tv, Aesop products and super nice biscuits from the restaurant downstairs, run by a very famous a great cook, Jean Francois Piege.
reviews.title: French style boutique hotel and restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's all the small details that make this hotel super cute. Everything is to a high standard. Maybe to not to the standard of someone expecting the Ritz. But it's highly fashionable and "young".
reviews.title: A nice boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After doing a long review of available boutique hotels in Paris, we chose Hotel Thoumieux based on location, design and price (at 200 euros) for a brief mid of the week break in the city. The 7th arrondisement was an excellent choice for the things we wanted to see (tour Eiffel, Quay Branly museum, St. Germain), while the hotel offered great service and very interesting design at a price which is hard to find in Paris. OK, the room was quite small, but this is a standard issue in this city. There are also 2 excellent restaurants, very trendy & pricey..!
reviews.title: Great value, very sexy..!

reviews.text: Lovely hotel, great location and decor, spacious room for Paris, excellent bakery across the street, great restaurants nearby. Unfortunately the room was too hot and stuffy to sleep, even with AC full on. With the windows open it was too noisy. A pity because otherwise it was great.
reviews.title: Overheated room spoiled stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband and I picked this hotel after seeing a nice write-up in Monocle magazine, mainly about its supreme design aesthetic. What a score.
reviews.title: Cool meets cozy - a nearly perfect hotel in the 7th Arr

reviews.text: After buzzing in to the discreet door along Rue Saint-Dominique, hotel manager Petra helped us with our bags (as other reviewers noted, there's a flight of stairs to the mezzanine level and stairs to your room, but hardly an issue to those of us who live in brownstone Brooklyn!)
reviews.title: a great single-girl-in-paris hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a splash of dynamite style: bold patterned wallpapers, funky lamps and sconces, seriously comfortable bed, an iPad filled with groovy French and lounge music, an espresso machine, a good sized bathroom filled with Aesop products - we hardly wanted to leave the room! Some have said the rooms of small (we stayed in a room one notch about the basic room - the double superior), but again, being from NYC this was nuthin. Just enough room - and that's all you need.
reviews.title: Little gem in the 7th arrondissement

reviews.text: Nice hotel close to invalides and tour eiffel, extremely warm staff. Rooms news and wide wirh all amenities needed.
reviews.title: Excelent Hotel, warm, new, fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommende it, we will come back.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

reviews.text: I was mant times in Paris in different hotels, I really liked this!!!!
reviews.title: nice place to stay in paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was tiny but oh so cute.My husband and i could hardly move about, tho we got used to it. Super clean and beds were very comfortable. Excellent location near the Eiffel tower and Napoleons tomb.Many restaurants and cafe nearby. Had a minor problem trying to get into hotel one night because there was no one at the front desk to buzz us in. Had to go next door to restaurant and come up an alternate stair ( a little disconcerting)
reviews.title: C'est tres chic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a stylish hotel, with good linen, towels, and bed. There is a coffee machine in the room. The localization is very good, close to a less tourist area , but within a walking distance to the main attractions. The room does not have a great space, but it is OK. The bathroom is large. There is a two star restaurant (expensive) and a very good brasserie downstairs. It is convenient for tourism in Paris, but a little overpriced, reflecting Paris prices.
reviews.title: Although the style is a matter of taste, the hotel is REALLY cozy
